Posts.Content: odinsmom wrote: June 1 I had my first mamo and was called back for second mamo and ultra sound on June 8.  I was told that I had 2 masses in my right breast that were highly suspicious.  I had to wait until June 15 for another mamo done by my dr.  June 25 I had a biopsy of both masses and was told June 28 that both masses are synchronous carcinomas, they are both invasive and have traits of both ductal and lobular carcinomas.  I am now waiting for July 8 to see my surgeon!  I thought I was handling it OK at first, but as time goes on I am getting increasingly nervous!  For the past couple of months I have also had pain in my rib cage that I am now worried might be cancer.  Any suggestions on how to tame the nerves? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and waiting is awful odinsmom dap1961

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2010 11:33AM odinsmom wrote: Thank you all for your replies!  You don't know how good it is to share this with other women who are going through the same thing!!! Actually you do don't you!  Just knowing that you all are out there and care enough to give support is amazing!  That fact in itself makes me less nervous.  Thank you sooo much!  Please keep in touch!  I am also new to this type of forum and am hoping that I am posting this right!  Love Ya girls!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and waiting is awful odinsmom dap1961

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 08:15AM odinsmom wrote: Cathy, Good Luck with your surgery on Friday!  Sending only good thoughts your way.  I have not had any scans yet either.  Had a breast MRI and of course core needle biopsies of both masses.  Stay strong!  Carol

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 11:52PM odinsmom wrote: Yea!  Finally got an OR date!  Will have right side mast on July 30.

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2010 12:32AM odinsmom wrote: Thanks for the info on how expanders are filled!  I was so overwelmed the day I say the PS that I didn't ask all the questions that I wanted to and wouldn't you know he left for vacation the next day and is not returning until the 21st of July!  I will have to wait until this Monday to know any OR date as his scheduler also took time off!  It really feels like there has been so many delays along the way so far!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and waiting is awful odinsmom dap1961

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2010 02:01AM odinsmom wrote: Gutsy,  We will have to compare notes!  Are you having a mast or lumpectomy?  Are you getting more nervous as the date approaches like me?  I am driving everyone at home mad trying to get everything done around the house (things that I usually would let slide) because I know I won't be able to get to them for a while.  Sending healing prayer your way!   Carol MeridethKO2,   You are so right about the ladies here and the wonder of the Internet!  I am going with my girls on the 20th for preadmit testing and teaching.  My girls are 32 and 30.  They are coming with their own questions so between the three of us we should be covered questionwise!
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and waiting is awful odinsmom dap1961

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2010 01:06AM odinsmom wrote: I had an appointment with multiple docs on July 8.  Besides the two invasive carcinomas with ductal and lobular traits aother site was found in my right breast that is DCI.  That was a bit of a shock to me.  I had a breast MRI, then saw a radiology oncologist, followed by my surgeon, then a medical oncologist, and finally a plastic surgeon.  I was disappointed at the end of the day because they all seemed to say I would really have to wait until my surgery to know if I will need radiation or chemo.  I am also not a candidate for a TRAM or DIEP flap reconstruction because of previous ORs.  So I will end up having an expander put in at time of OR and end up with an implant.  Has anyone had an expander?  How are they filled/  do they inject through some type of port?
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed and waiting is awful odinsmom dap1961

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2010 09:55AM odinsmom wrote: Hi Girls!  My name is Carol and I will be joining your July group!  July 30 I will have a right side mast with tissue expanders.  I am just so glad at this point to have an OR date!  Wishing you all well on your journey!  Carol
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2010 12:00AM - edited Sep 15, 2010 12:08AM by odinsmom Sorry I have been missing in action since my July 30th LMX.  Between the computer being down for a couple of weeks and a nasty bladder infection post OR I just have now been in the mood to write.  The path report showed 2 invasive carcinomas with ductal and lobular traits, an area of DCIS, multiple papilomas and hyperplasia and metaplasia in the breast. 0/7 lymphnodes! Yea! I only had one drain but the drain was removed at 5 weeks even though it was still having a lot of drainage.  Drainage began to build up the next two days and my incision which had an area of infection opened and drainage leaked out. The original incision site was glued closed. I went back to Or where opened the entire incision and irrigated the entire area and inserted another drain in a slightly different site.  They also trimmed some of the skin that was infected and sutured me closed.  A week later the drain suddenly stopped.  IMy BS removed the second drain and aspirated fluid.Fluid built up again and had it drained again. I am headed to my BS tomorrow because of more fluid build up. BS will decide if another OR is needed to correct the fluid build up.  Has anyone had this kind of trouble with drainage?  I feel like I am doing well but each OR also feels like a set back.   Carol
Posts.Title: JULY MASTECTOMY orchidgal rosesrx
